utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: But let me--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right. Why aren't the Democrats allowing that? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: When President Obama--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: --that done?

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: When we had operations like the ones this past weekend the President was supposed to have, we focused it on criminals. That's the difference that this is basically an attempt to bully families when he could be going after people with criminal records.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: No - OK. So this is the language you're using. So the rule of law shouldn't apply to families?

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: Instead of focusing on the asylum process, instead of focusing on the-- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK. But you just contradicted yourself. I want to play something from yesterday.

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not contradicting myself.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes, you did. You contradict yourself. Del Rio Border Patrol Station. This is Eagle Pass, I believe, the video we're going to show you. I was there six weeks ago. This is a processing center where Border Patrol agents are basically turned into - I mean, they are doing the best they can, kind of helping run a semi day care center. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We have to remove from the field patrols to fill bottles, and the good thing is many of us are parents. So we know had to change diapers and we know how to feed bottles. A lot of this is brought in by the agents themselves. We are parents. So a lot of the agents have two, three, four kids. When they outgrow, these are the hand-me-downs. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Agents are bringing their families' clothing in to help children who arrive because we pulled them out of the river with nothing. They have nothing. They have literally nothing but the clothes on their back.

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: So let's focus on the care of the children and not putting poison pills.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: So - so let's be clear. The Democrats control the House. They haven't sent a bill to the Senate that takes care of these kids. They have been the first part of these - you are saying there was a manufactured crisis. They refused to admit that we have a flood of kids and adults coming to our border and they haven't sent the money that's necessary to take care of kids. And so when we look at the conditions, no doubt they're horrible because we don't have money to take care of that. So--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: We have breaking news. We have breaking news, guys. We just learned moments ago that senior Democrat officials have announced they do not have the votes for the supplemental. Am I getting that right, guys? Not - don't have the votes. Don't have the Democrat votes. I mean, Trump administration says we need to care for these children, we need to have facilities to hold children and--

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: And you're trying to pair it up with aggressive enforcement measures that--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: But - OK. But you-- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: --that are poisoning well.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: You said final orders of deportation should be honored by U.S. courts and U.S. authorities. Correct?

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: They should. They should.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK. So 590,000 orders of deportation.

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: Where is the effort to actually put more judges on the case and people to deal with these--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I think Trump has already said he want to do that. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Here's what you're missing. Democrats, in their control, could put down a slimmed bill with $4.5 billion to help the kids. They haven't done it yet.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez says no.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: And that's problem.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Ilhan Omar says no. Both of them said no. I think there are Democrats. There are some - I shouldn't say all the - I think there are some honest broker Democrats who actually want to get this done. I think the Democrats want to separate Trump from his core supporters on this issue who are not heartless people, they don't want children to suffer, they don't want them to die in the desert or anywhere else. But a magnet at the border is bad for everybody. It's bad for the cartels getting rich, it's bad for our crime, it's bad for American citizens who need help. It's we - we're out of solutions unless someone is going to just make money appear off of trees here to help these kids.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: If you heard what (ph) Luis says, in Congress, you would actually get something done because you--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes. Luis would probably get it done.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: --you want to stop the flood of people coming to the border and you want to take care of kids, but there's no interest in that because what you said in your monologue is true that Democrats want this as a political issue. The kids are pawns, the migrants are pawns-- Â MIRANDA: Nobody-- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: --they want votes. But then you should secure the border because they're dying on the trip.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: But they're actually saying there are Democrats.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: They're being raped and they're being killed on the trip--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And I will still--

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: You've contradicted yourself. You showed President Obama himself making this case. We agree that we don't want-- a magnet.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I agree

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: --a magnet.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: No. I was - I was praising him.

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: But we have to take care of the kids. And we can take care of the kids without adding extra poison pills--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.sentences: --that just make the situation at the border worse.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I was giving President Obama thumbs up on that. Panel, thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.sentences: Thanks, Laura.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: We have a lot more to get to. And now my message to the administration. Listen to the voices of the people we spoke to in Orlando last week.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Do you support the President deporting these people with final deportation?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: These are policies that were put in place by the Obama administration. Clinton has talked about it. They have all talked about it. The only difference is the President at the podium has changed.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: It's ridiculous, well, who's coming in and how they're coming in. And it just - there has to be rules, there has to be regulations.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Come to this country and come the right way, just like many others have done--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Did you hear him? All of them. Anyone in this administration, who is not on board with strong, consistent, fairly applied measures to address this crisis, deter future border crossers and deport those who've lost their cases, should quit or be fired. We have no time to spare. The message is simple. We have limited resources and we must devote them first to Americans in need. Remind America that those who are on track to be deported this week were given all of the process they were due under U.S. law. None of us could ignore a court order with impunity, but the new radicals running the Democrat Party think illegal immigrants should be able to do just that and a lot more, frankly. Mr. President, most of America is with you. According to a new Gallup survey, immigration ranks as one of the most important issues facing us today. A few weeks ago, people who were chastising the President for threatening tariffs against Mexico, remember, unless Mexico started getting serious about stopping the massive flow from Central America. Well, this is a tweet from a reporter in Mexico. "Breaking, Mexico has deployed almost 15,000 troops to the U.S.-Mexico border to curve immigration flow. An additional 2,000 National Guard elements have also been deployed across the country's southern border with Guatemala and Belize." Never seen anything like this. The President's instincts immigration are right. This newfound cooperation from Mexico is only happening because the President defied all the experts who've been wrong all along. And on interior enforcement, now is not the time to hesitate. There seem to be no honest brokers left in today's Democrat Party after all. What is their aim? Well, it's to demonize Trump and demoralize his base. On the one issue, other than the economy, that is his most potent, immigration. President Trump must not allow this to happen, and instead, continue to focus on America first in restoring safety and security at our Southern border. Coming up, it was a big weekend for our favorite 2020 Democrat fanatics, and they didn't disappoint. Has Mayor Pete reached the end of the road? Dan Bongino and Hahn debate it in moments.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: As we documented months ago, the Democratic Party thought they found their latest rising star in Pete Buttigieg. But South Bend Mayor stock is dropping after a wild weekend back in South Bend where he tried to calm the citizens who were in an uproar over the shooting death of a black man by a white police officer. And let's just say, things didn't go all that well for Pete.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You don't have votes, which I doubt you're going to get it. Do your job just so you can have a moral (inaudible) leave this place.

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You've been saying thank you. But the end of the--

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.sentences: Thank you. Your time is up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: --rising Pete--

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.sentences: Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Get the people that are racists off the streets.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We are here to fix the situation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You're running for President or you're running (inaudible) for you?

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.sentences: I'm not asking for your vote.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You are not going to get it either.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So that was painful. Joining me now, Dan Bongino, Former Secret Service Agent, Fox News Contributor; Chris Hahn, former aide to Chuck Schumer, host of the Aggressive Progressive podcast. Dan, is Mayor Pete toast? Is this enough to kind of drop his stock? DAN BONGINO, FORMER SECRET SERVICE AGENT & FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR: I'm not sure, Laura. This field is so abysmally awful. I thought Elizabeth Warren was done after that horrendous Charlamagne interview where he compared it to Rachel Dolezal. I said there's no recovering from that. Next thing you know, she's up 10 points. This field is so bad. I'm not sure. But listen, be very serious. That was an awful, awful appearance by the Mayor Pete there. He just didn't look in control of the situation, didn't look in command. But is he done? Who knows? The field is so bad, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Chris, he looked younger than his 30 something years I think in dealing with the situation. CHRIS HAHN, FORMER AIDE TO SENATOR CHUCK SCHUMER & HOST, AGGRESSIVE PROGRESSIVE PODCAST: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It was an easy situation to deal with. Part of me thought it was kind of gutsy to go back to South Bend and take the--

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: --take the incoming. But he is the Mayor and there is a big uproar there and big concern. So part of it, I was kind of--

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: That's kind of cool that he went back there. On the other hand, I though he looked a little out of his depth in answering the questions.

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.sentences: Well, 90 percent of life is showing up. He showed up. He had some empathy. It's a tough situation. I don't know how to handle that situation. I don't know how, if anybody, would know how to handle that situation. Whether or not this sinks his Presidential campaign, I don't know. The young thing has always been a problem for him, and you pointed out correctly. And my boy Dan here sounds just like me in 2015. I sounded the exact same way about the Republican field. Dan, you almost said the same words. I don't know if you were watching YouTube videos of me from 2015 to brush up your (inaudible), but it sounded just like me. So I don't know if he is gone. I know that there are a lot of good candidates in this field and it's going to be a lot of miles between here and the nomination and even more miles between here and the election. And everybody better be on their toes because a lot of things are going to happen. There's 18 months, that's an eternity in politics, Laura. I don't need to tell you that.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: You're right. And you have to have the African-American vote pretty strong though I think if you're a Democrat.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Do I get to respond to that?

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes, real quick. Real quick, and I got to-

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: --move on to free stuff.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Yes. Chris, are you always this dumb? I mean, number one, I just said he wasn't done. And number two, the only YouTube videos of me and you are me annihilating you in debates on this channel.

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.sentences: Oh.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: There are no other YouTube videos. So I just wanted that. OK, we can move on.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK. All right. All right. Now, the Democrats are also, guys, engaged in this new game of free stuff one upmanship. And here's Bernie Sanders with the latest, fairly bonkers entry?

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: This proposal completely eliminates student debt in this country. Our proposal, which cost $2.2 trillion over 10 years, will be fully paid for by a tax on Wall Street's speculation.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Dan, he's trying to undercut and outbid Elizabeth Warren I think with the freebie craziness. But who doesn't want a tax speculator? I mean, it sounds so good. They're speculating after all.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Tax, and then we'll pay $2.2 trillion. Wasn't it just $1.6 trillion yesterday?

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Now it's $2.2 trillion today. I'm getting at a trillion here or there I guess. Let's call--

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: I heard someone on the channel this weekend, Laura - forgive me, I'm - I would attribute it, but I don't remember who, and they said it the perfect way. they said it's like a reverse auction on the Democrat Party. Right? It's not that you're taking money for people to pay, you're giving stuff away. But this is ridiculous because, remember, it's a lot of middle- class pension funds that are invested in these very financial instruments that are earning middle-class workers in income in their retirement. You're going to collapse the stock market and middle-class incomes in pensions at the exact same time. And frankly, Laura, I could explain third-party payer economics all night, but the reality is I don't want to pay for my neighbor's kids' college. I've got my own daughters and my own student loans to pay off. I'm not interested.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Chris, I mean, you do eventually run out of other people's money. And I mean, it does sound nice. Everything is free. I mean, everyone wants loan forgiveness. It sounds great probably for everybody. Car loans and--

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: --mortgage loan. But this just kind of seems now just patently ridiculous. I mean-- In fact, I think the low cost of debt has caused some of this problem in education across this country because universities get off the hook for charging higher and higher rates. So I would like to see something done in this country to reduce college debt. I don't know if making it taking away the debt is going to change it. We've got to do something. We want to make sure that--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: We have a rare moment of agreement.

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.sentences: --everyone has a chance to go to college and afford college.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right. Real quick. Interview today, President Trump questioned why Biden's best buddy, Barack, hasn't endorsed him yet.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: How he doesn't get President Obama to endorse him? There has to be some reason why he's not endorsing him. Now President Obama is not endorsing him is rather a big secret. And then he goes and lies and said I asked the President not to endorse me. Give me a break. So it could be that President Obama knows something, but there is something going on in that brain of his.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Dan, why is Obama not stepping up?

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: Come on, Laura. It--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Trump is always on that kind of--

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.sentences: It's embarrassing. Yes, it's embarrassing. Biden is an awful candidate, but he was at least loyal to Obama. You don't endorse your VP who stood by your side through that awful Obamacare? Come on. Trump is calling it like it is. You know it's embarrassing.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right. Real quick --

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.sentences: Laura--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: --Chris.

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.sentences: --you know what? Former presidents never get involved in their party's primary four years later. This President, Donald Trump, will probably be the first person to do that when he is out of office, I'm sure.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: All right. Up next - thanks, guys - as Trump is being castigated for his border policies, two members of his cabinet urging Congress to address this humanitarian crisis. But will they receive any support from the Democrats? HHS Secretary Alex Azar joins me exclusively. He'll react to the breaking news tonight out of Congress.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: As we told you at the top of the show, Fox News reporting tonight, the Democrats are balking at the supplemental border request of $4.5 billion. So let me just get this straight -- they claim President Trump is making this crisis worse, yet they will not step up to fix these facilities and actually pay for beds for children. Joining me now exclusively on this and huge breaking news today on pricing transparency for prescription drugs, HHS Secretary Alex Azar. All right, Secretary Azar, thanks for being here tonight. Your response to tonight's news before we get to this amazing event at the White House.

utterances.speaker: ALEX AZAR, HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES SECRETARY
utterances.sentences: Laura, it is just incredibly troubling. We have a humanitarian crisis at the border. We have got families and kids flooding across our border in unprecedented numbers. I'm full. At HHS, as you know, we get unaccompanied alien children. A 12-year-old girl comes across the border by yourself. What do you do with her? Congress says give her to HSS and we take care of her in these shelters. We are full, and we're running out of money. We need this money to take care of these kids.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So 72 hours you're supposed to transfer to HHS facilities, but there's no facilities.

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.sentences: I can't put a kid in a bed that doesn't exist, and I can't make a bed that Congress doesn't fund.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Jake Tapper had Julian Castro on over the weekend. Check it out.

utterances.speaker: JAKE TAPPER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.sentences: If HHS needs $3 billion more dollars to improve the conditions to build more housing, wouldn't that alleviate it? You are talking about not giving one more dime, and it doesn't make any sense to me.

utterances.speaker: JULIAN CASTRO, D- PRESIDENT CANDIDATE
utterances.sentences: I wouldn't give them one more time for these types of conditions. I don't have confidence that if you give them more money right now -- if they have a plan to actually have different conditions.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Your response to that?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.sentences: What conditions are we talking about? We provide these kids some of the safest, most secure environments that they some of these kids have unfortunately ever had. They are provided a safe environment. They are provided three square meals a day. They're provided snacks. When we have funding from Congress, they get recreation. They have full education services.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Do they have health and dental?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.sentences: They get medical, they get mental health, they get dental, they get vision. And, by the way, there is this false narrative that somehow we are trying to keep these kids with us for a long period of time. Our goal at HHS is to have these kids with us for zero days if we could. We don't want any kids in their care. We have actually decreased the average number of days a kid stays with us from over 90 days down to 44 days. That is how fast we are trying to get the kids out to sponsors, family members here in the United States. So we don't want any kid with us one day longer than they have to be.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: This is not what HHS or the U.S. government doesn't have facilities to detain families. That's -- we never had this problem until the magnet was created at the border. One federal, you and I both clerked together. The federal courts have a lot of power in putting these nationwide injunctions. You've seen it at HHS across a whole bunch of issues, and I think that's another issue this administration has to hit. We have to talk about what's going on with prescription drug crisis. If I hear from one more person of the cost of prescription drugs, the president said he was going to deliver. Today, I'm looking at Twitter. The president could be delivering on this. I'm going to be skeptical. What has happened?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.sentences: So what the president did today is he signed an executive order that does what Democrats and Republicans for decades have said we should do, which is have transparency of pricing and quality in our health care system.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Meaning if you go to get an MRI on your neck?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.sentences: You should know before you go how much it will cost, and you ought to know where else you can get it cheaper, and you ought to know the quality of the service where its' delivered.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And that one would drive the price down, obviously, like with Lasik surgery, we had the prices come down over the years.

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.sentences: What is one part of health care that actually functions, Lasik surgery. Every year quality goes up and price goes down. It's the only part of our economy where we don't have pricing.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Why hasn't this been done before?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.sentences: Because nobody has ever had the courage that President Trump has to take on the special interests. Trust me, Laura, they are going to come out with their teeth and claws and go after us for this.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: I'm worried there are people -- this is my view but maybe I'm all wrong -- inside the administration who are such purists, like libertarian purists. You can't do this. But this is the president's agenda, is it not? He is a conservative realist. And he's a bit of a populist on this issue. These prices have to come down and there has be fairness across the board for Americans seeking this care.

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.sentences: The president is absolutely a populist on health care. He is looking out for the average worker. His motto is, I want affordable, personalized, patient centered health because it puts you in control that treats you like a human being and not like a number.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Are the Democrats giving you a high five? Any support, thanks, we'll work?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.sentences: Actually, on this area of transparency on price and quality, I think we all can get together on that. In fact, I have gotten communications from some Democrats today saying, wow, you guys are actually doing that? Â We can't believe you have the courage to take on these special interests.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, I've been warning about them for years. I'm sure there are good people there, but this is an ad they ran against you, Alex. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: In America, the government doesn't set drug prices or block seniors' access to life-saving drugs because a bureaucrat decides it's not worth the price. But that's exactly what happens in many foreign countries. Now the Department of Health and Human Services wants to impose the same failed foreign price controls on Medicare.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: It's like a movie trailer, the secretary, you're the villain. I like the ones that show your face and make you look really scary, and you're not really that scary.

utterances.speaker: AZAR

utterances.speaker: AZAR

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM

utterances.speaker: GOV. GAVIN NEWSOM, D-CALIF.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Most people say it's an expression, like man up.

utterances.speaker: NEWSOM
utterances.sentences: That reinforces the framing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: But you're saying that --

utterances.speaker: NEWSOM
utterances.sentences: I think that is a weak thing to say. They been sold a complete bill of bullshit. The Republican Party has walked off a cliff. They are third party status. They don't even know what is about to hit them.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Governor Newsom's comments were revealed just a day after an ABC affiliate in Houston created a story about a nine-year-old boy who is a drag queen spreading a, quote, message of love. Dr. Lieberman, I want to begin with Governor Newsom of your state saying this is a dark, dark situation with masculinity in America. Â Your view?

utterances.speaker: DR. CAROLE LIEBERMAN, PSYCHIATRIST
utterances.sentences: Well, yes, obviously, he was traumatized as a young boy by people telling him to man up and not to be a sissy and so on. And he is still traumatized by it. And he's projecting onto Trump about this hypermasculinity because, really, he has done more to go against Trump and, in fact, making decisions that really are more about making Trump angry then what's best for California. And so he's trying to -- hypermasculinity, all about physical strength, aggression, and sexuality. And who is the biggest man? And he's putting himself opposite Trump and trying to show that he's the bigger man.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: OK, now I see why you're a psychiatrist. That is a really great analysis, because he's trying to one up, like men do, they try to one up each other.

utterances.speaker: LIEBERMAN
utterances.sentences: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: So he's actually doing in policy and rhetoric what he claims men are doing by flexing their muscles or saying "man up." I love that. That is something I hadn't thought of.

utterances.speaker: LIEBERMAN
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Can I ask about this other situation, with a lot of mothers, you go on mom blogs and online and social media. I want to show you a boy in Austin, Texas, in a video that ABC Houston showed. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: KEEGAN, NINE-YEAR-OLD DRAG QUEEN
utterances.sentences: I want the world to know that you can be special, and you can be who you want to be. You can be a vegetarian. You can even be a veterinarian. You can be LGBTQ, you can be a drag queen, drag king.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: His mom said she's not pushing any political agenda. We have no agenda. It's all about basically not trying to put a label on this. Your thoughts?

utterances.speaker: LIEBERMAN
utterances.sentences: I think that his mother and father should be arrested for child abuse is what I really think. They are turning this child into a puppet for their -- to get attention for them, to get money through social media and through these appearances, and so on. It's not about what he wants to do. He's only nine-years-old. Look at him, how he talked in that video. Â There is something not real about it. And kids are too young to know about sexuality, to know about gender, to have all of these things thrown at them, oftentimes in school. They are being taught things that really they don't understand these things at this age. And it is totally messing them up. And when they get to be teenagers, when they have puberty and they start thinking for themselves about what they want, that is when things are really going to come home to roost because they're going to feel suicidal and so on. They don't understand. All they know is that he's getting a lot of attention for this and his parents are happy. What it has to do with, for the most part, parents like to think that they are being progressive, and really what it has to do with is his some psychological issues that the parents have that they're projecting onto their child.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Well, and dressing a little boy up as Carol Channing, and he obviously doesn't know who Carol Channing is. People talk about JonBenet Ramsey and the pageants, and they thought that was sexualization, 1996. Â Look at where we are all these years later, and this is being celebrated by a local -- it's very tough. And it's all about the children and protecting children. I think everyone, every mother and every father, it's about protecting children. We don't want anyone bullied, and we don't want kids to be sexualized at a young age. It's just wrong.

utterances.speaker: LIEBERMAN
utterances.sentences: Right, right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Dr. Lieberman, we need to do a longer segment on this. We are out of time, but this is just wild. Thank you so much. Tiana Lowe, the reporter for The Washington Examiner who spent five days in Omar's district joins me now. So Tiana, tell us what is going on here. utterances.speaker: TIANA LOWE, JOURNALIST, WASHINGTON EXAMINER
utterances.sentences: So we have always known that Ilhan Omar's marital history has been complicated because her current husband, Ahmed Hirsi, is who she was married to from 2002, and then she said that they split up in 2008 for her to marry Ahmed Elmi from 2009 to 2011. However, I went back and found some misdemeanor and petty misdemeanor filings from the Hennepin County courthouse which showed that she and Ahmed Hirsi, who she said that she had been split up at the time, were living at the same residence in the Cedar Riverside neighborhood of Minneapolis.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: And is this unrelated to other allocations about family members and being involved with them? What's that? People are messaging me, asking me for this flow chart. I said I have no idea. I can't follow any of these. It seems like there's interior contradictions, however.

utterances.speaker: LOWE
utterances.sentences: So in 2016 Alpha News obtained screenshots of Ahmed Elmi, so her now ex-husband's social media posts, which seem to indicate that he had been in contact with Ilhan Omar after she said that they had split up and she had no way of contacting him under penalty of perjury during her divorce proceedings. But we didn't necessarily have official records proving that she and Ahmed Hirsi were living together in what was effectively a common- law marriage for the entirety of adult life. Again, it is fully possible that in these traffic proceedings and in these misdemeanor charges that we obtained that it was just by default that it listed the same address. But the fact is that reporters have been asking Omar to be explain why she was married to one man and living with another for years on end repeatedly misconstruing the situation, or just straight up rejecting the free press' inquiries into her marital history. And it would be a matter of public --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes, and what do you think the motivation would be?

utterances.speaker: LOWE
utterances.sentences: It then implies that there was a cover-up. Ahmed Hirsi was the father of two of her children prior to her marriage to Elmi. There is a very realistic position where if money was tight and if the divorce was amicable, sure, I could see all three of them living in a house if he couldn't afford to rent somewhere else. That would be a very easy thing to explain away. But instead there has been repeated attempts to deflect the press and repeated attempts to malign the press and impugn our motives as racist. The fact that she is now a public officials --

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: Yes, and one of the most high-profile, Tiana, public officials, high-profile critics, saying all kinds of outrageous things about 9/11, thoughts that she is anti-Semitic, a lot of American are unhappy with some of her expressed sentiments. utterances.speaker: LOWE
utterances.sentences: Yes, it certainly seems like a thing that shouldn't just be asked of her. It should be asked of Nancy Pelosi, it should be asked of AOC, how do you explain this away?

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.sentences: They won't touch it. Tiana, thank you for being here tonight. Â We really appreciate it. When we come back, the Last Bite.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What the hell is this all about? I need loyalty.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You will always get honesty from me.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: That is what I want, honest loyalty. Mueller has to go. Call me back when you do it.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE

utterances.utterance: But it doesn't look like Pelosi is interested in doing any of that, especially since Congress is only in session until this Friday. I have a message for the administration in a bit, but don't be deceived by the media coverage or the emotive images you are seeing because it happened years ago and the Democrats were silent. The Democrats want to eliminate all detentions and these politicians, corrupt lawyers, activist judges and NGOs will characterize almost any holding facility as a concentration camp and then shut them down. So no detentions, no deportations ever. Ultimately, they hope full voting rights for those who came illegally. End of story. Pelosi is not going to end this crisis. Here now to respond, Republican Congressman Sean Duffy of Wisconsin, and Luis Miranda, Former DNC Comms Director. utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.utterance: I don't want to see them dying, Laura. I don't want to see them dying.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Right. So why do we have a magnet?

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.utterance: And this is why (inaudible) supposed to be in charge of taking care of these kids.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.utterance: I agree. Those are the ones that--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM

utterances.utterance: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA

utterances.utterance: I think Trump has already said he want to do that.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Here's what you're missing. Democrats, in their control, could put down a slimmed bill with $4.5 billion to help the kids. They haven't done it yet.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez says no.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.utterance: And that's problem.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Ilhan Omar says no. Both of them said no. I think there are Democrats. There are some - I shouldn't say all the - I think there are some honest broker Democrats who actually want to get this done. I think the Democrats want to separate Trump from his core supporters on this issue who are not heartless people, they don't want children to suffer, they don't want them to die in the desert or anywhere else. But a magnet at the border is bad for everybody. It's bad for the cartels getting rich, it's bad for our crime, it's bad for American citizens who need help. It's we - we're out of solutions unless someone is going to just make money appear off of trees here to help these kids.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.utterance: If you heard what (ph) Luis says, in Congress, you would actually get something done because you--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes. Luis would probably get it done.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.utterance: --you want to stop the flood of people coming to the border and you want to take care of kids, but there's no interest in that because what you said in your monologue is true that Democrats want this as a political issue. The kids are pawns, the migrants are pawns-- Â MIRANDA: Nobody--

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.utterance: --they want votes. But then you should secure the border because they're dying on the trip.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: But they're actually saying there are Democrats.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.utterance: They're being raped and they're being killed on the trip--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: And I will still--

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.utterance: You've contradicted yourself. You showed President Obama himself making this case. We agree that we don't want-- a magnet.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I agree

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.utterance: --a magnet.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: No. I was - I was praising him.

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.utterance: But we have to take care of the kids. And we can take care of the kids without adding extra poison pills--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: MIRANDA
utterances.utterance: --that just make the situation at the border worse.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I was giving President Obama thumbs up on that. Panel, thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Thanks, Laura.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: We have a lot more to get to. And now my message to the administration. Listen to the voices of the people we spoke to in Orlando last week.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Do you support the President deporting these people with final deportation?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: These are policies that were put in place by the Obama administration. Clinton has talked about it. They have all talked about it. The only difference is the President at the podium has changed.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It's ridiculous, well, who's coming in and how they're coming in. And it just - there has to be rules, there has to be regulations.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Come to this country and come the right way, just like many others have done--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Did you hear him? All of them. Anyone in this administration, who is not on board with strong, consistent, fairly applied measures to address this crisis, deter future border crossers and deport those who've lost their cases, should quit or be fired. We have no time to spare. The message is simple. We have limited resources and we must devote them first to Americans in need. Remind America that those who are on track to be deported this week were given all of the process they were due under U.S. law. None of us could ignore a court order with impunity, but the new radicals running the Democrat Party think illegal immigrants should be able to do just that and a lot more, frankly. Mr. President, most of America is with you. According to a new Gallup survey, immigration ranks as one of the most important issues facing us today. A few weeks ago, people who were chastising the President for threatening tariffs against Mexico, remember, unless Mexico started getting serious about stopping the massive flow from Central America. Well, this is a tweet from a reporter in Mexico. "Breaking, Mexico has deployed almost 15,000 troops to the U.S.-Mexico border to curve immigration flow. An additional 2,000 National Guard elements have also been deployed across the country's southern border with Guatemala and Belize." Never seen anything like this. The President's instincts immigration are right. This newfound cooperation from Mexico is only happening because the President defied all the experts who've been wrong all along. And on interior enforcement, now is not the time to hesitate. There seem to be no honest brokers left in today's Democrat Party after all. What is their aim? Well, it's to demonize Trump and demoralize his base. On the one issue, other than the economy, that is his most potent, immigration. President Trump must not allow this to happen, and instead, continue to focus on America first in restoring safety and security at our Southern border. Coming up, it was a big weekend for our favorite 2020 Democrat fanatics, and they didn't disappoint. Has Mayor Pete reached the end of the road? Dan Bongino and Hahn debate it in moments.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: As we documented months ago, the Democratic Party thought they found their latest rising star in Pete Buttigieg. But South Bend Mayor stock is dropping after a wild weekend back in South Bend where he tried to calm the citizens who were in an uproar over the shooting death of a black man by a white police officer. And let's just say, things didn't go all that well for Pete.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: You don't have votes, which I doubt you're going to get it. Do your job just so you can have a moral (inaudible) leave this place.

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.utterance: Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: You've been saying thank you. But the end of the--

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Your time is up.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: --rising Pete--

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.utterance: Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Get the people that are racists off the streets.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: We are here to fix the situation.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: You're running for President or you're running (inaudible) for you?

utterances.speaker: BUTTIGIEG
utterances.utterance: I'm not asking for your vote.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: You are not going to get it either.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So that was painful. Joining me now, Dan Bongino, Former Secret Service Agent, Fox News Contributor; Chris Hahn, former aide to Chuck Schumer, host of the Aggressive Progressive podcast. Dan, is Mayor Pete toast? Is this enough to kind of drop his stock? DAN BONGINO, FORMER SECRET SERVICE AGENT & FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR: I'm not sure, Laura. This field is so abysmally awful. I thought Elizabeth Warren was done after that horrendous Charlamagne interview where he compared it to Rachel Dolezal. I said there's no recovering from that. Next thing you know, she's up 10 points. This field is so bad. I'm not sure. But listen, be very serious. That was an awful, awful appearance by the Mayor Pete there. He just didn't look in control of the situation, didn't look in command. But is he done? Who knows? The field is so bad, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Chris, he looked younger than his 30 something years I think in dealing with the situation. CHRIS HAHN, FORMER AIDE TO SENATOR CHUCK SCHUMER & HOST, AGGRESSIVE PROGRESSIVE PODCAST: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: It was an easy situation to deal with. Part of me thought it was kind of gutsy to go back to South Bend and take the--

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: --take the incoming. But he is the Mayor and there is a big uproar there and big concern. So part of it, I was kind of--

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: That's kind of cool that he went back there. On the other hand, I though he looked a little out of his depth in answering the questions.

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.utterance: Well, 90 percent of life is showing up. He showed up. He had some empathy. It's a tough situation. I don't know how to handle that situation. I don't know how, if anybody, would know how to handle that situation. Whether or not this sinks his Presidential campaign, I don't know. The young thing has always been a problem for him, and you pointed out correctly. And my boy Dan here sounds just like me in 2015. I sounded the exact same way about the Republican field. Dan, you almost said the same words. I don't know if you were watching YouTube videos of me from 2015 to brush up your (inaudible), but it sounded just like me. So I don't know if he is gone. I know that there are a lot of good candidates in this field and it's going to be a lot of miles between here and the nomination and even more miles between here and the election. And everybody better be on their toes because a lot of things are going to happen. There's 18 months, that's an eternity in politics, Laura. I don't need to tell you that.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: You're right. And you have to have the African-American vote pretty strong though I think if you're a Democrat.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Do I get to respond to that?

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Yes, real quick. Real quick, and I got to-

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: --move on to free stuff.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Chris, are you always this dumb? I mean, number one, I just said he wasn't done. And number two, the only YouTube videos of me and you are me annihilating you in debates on this channel.

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.utterance: Oh.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: There are no other YouTube videos. So I just wanted that. OK, we can move on.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: OK. All right. All right. Now, the Democrats are also, guys, engaged in this new game of free stuff one upmanship. And here's Bernie Sanders with the latest, fairly bonkers entry?

utterances.speaker: SEN. BERNIE SANDERS, I-VT., PRESIDENTIAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: This proposal completely eliminates student debt in this country. Our proposal, which cost $2.2 trillion over 10 years, will be fully paid for by a tax on Wall Street's speculation.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Dan, he's trying to undercut and outbid Elizabeth Warren I think with the freebie craziness. But who doesn't want a tax speculator? I mean, it sounds so good. They're speculating after all.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Tax, and then we'll pay $2.2 trillion. Wasn't it just $1.6 trillion yesterday?

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Now it's $2.2 trillion today. I'm getting at a trillion here or there I guess. Let's call--

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: I heard someone on the channel this weekend, Laura - forgive me, I'm - I would attribute it, but I don't remember who, and they said it the perfect way. they said it's like a reverse auction on the Democrat Party. Right? It's not that you're taking money for people to pay, you're giving stuff away. But this is ridiculous because, remember, it's a lot of middle- class pension funds that are invested in these very financial instruments that are earning middle-class workers in income in their retirement. You're going to collapse the stock market and middle-class incomes in pensions at the exact same time. And frankly, Laura, I could explain third-party payer economics all night, but the reality is I don't want to pay for my neighbor's kids' college. I've got my own daughters and my own student loans to pay off. I'm not interested.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Chris, I mean, you do eventually run out of other people's money. And I mean, it does sound nice. Everything is free. I mean, everyone wants loan forgiveness. It sounds great probably for everybody. Car loans and--

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: --mortgage loan. But this just kind of seems now just patently ridiculous. I mean-- In fact, I think the low cost of debt has caused some of this problem in education across this country because universities get off the hook for charging higher and higher rates. So I would like to see something done in this country to reduce college debt. I don't know if making it taking away the debt is going to change it. We've got to do something. We want to make sure that--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: We have a rare moment of agreement.

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.utterance: --everyone has a chance to go to college and afford college.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: All right. Real quick. Interview today, President Trump questioned why Biden's best buddy, Barack, hasn't endorsed him yet.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: How he doesn't get President Obama to endorse him? There has to be some reason why he's not endorsing him. Now President Obama is not endorsing him is rather a big secret. And then he goes and lies and said I asked the President not to endorse me. Give me a break. So it could be that President Obama knows something, but there is something going on in that brain of his.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Dan, why is Obama not stepping up?

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Come on, Laura. It--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Trump is always on that kind of--

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: It's embarrassing. Yes, it's embarrassing. Biden is an awful candidate, but he was at least loyal to Obama. You don't endorse your VP who stood by your side through that awful Obamacare? Come on. Trump is calling it like it is. You know it's embarrassing.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: All right. Real quick --

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.utterance: Laura--

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: --Chris.

utterances.speaker: HAHN
utterances.utterance: --you know what? Former presidents never get involved in their party's primary four years later. This President, Donald Trump, will probably be the first person to do that when he is out of office, I'm sure.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: All right. Up next - thanks, guys - as Trump is being castigated for his border policies, two members of his cabinet urging Congress to address this humanitarian crisis. But will they receive any support from the Democrats? HHS Secretary Alex Azar joins me exclusively. He'll react to the breaking news tonight out of Congress.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: As we told you at the top of the show, Fox News reporting tonight, the Democrats are balking at the supplemental border request of $4.5 billion. So let me just get this straight -- they claim President Trump is making this crisis worse, yet they will not step up to fix these facilities and actually pay for beds for children. Joining me now exclusively on this and huge breaking news today on pricing transparency for prescription drugs, HHS Secretary Alex Azar. All right, Secretary Azar, thanks for being here tonight. Your response to tonight's news before we get to this amazing event at the White House.

utterances.speaker: ALEX AZAR, HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES SECRETARY
utterances.utterance: Laura, it is just incredibly troubling. We have a humanitarian crisis at the border. We have got families and kids flooding across our border in unprecedented numbers. I'm full. At HHS, as you know, we get unaccompanied alien children. A 12-year-old girl comes across the border by yourself. What do you do with her? Congress says give her to HSS and we take care of her in these shelters. We are full, and we're running out of money. We need this money to take care of these kids.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So 72 hours you're supposed to transfer to HHS facilities, but there's no facilities.

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: I can't put a kid in a bed that doesn't exist, and I can't make a bed that Congress doesn't fund.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Jake Tapper had Julian Castro on over the weekend. Check it out.

utterances.speaker: JAKE TAPPER, CNN ANCHOR
utterances.utterance: If HHS needs $3 billion more dollars to improve the conditions to build more housing, wouldn't that alleviate it? You are talking about not giving one more dime, and it doesn't make any sense to me.

utterances.speaker: JULIAN CASTRO, D- PRESIDENT CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: I wouldn't give them one more time for these types of conditions. I don't have confidence that if you give them more money right now -- if they have a plan to actually have different conditions.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Your response to that?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: What conditions are we talking about? We provide these kids some of the safest, most secure environments that they some of these kids have unfortunately ever had. They are provided a safe environment. They are provided three square meals a day. They're provided snacks. When we have funding from Congress, they get recreation. They have full education services.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Do they have health and dental?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: They get medical, they get mental health, they get dental, they get vision. And, by the way, there is this false narrative that somehow we are trying to keep these kids with us for a long period of time. Our goal at HHS is to have these kids with us for zero days if we could. We don't want any kids in their care. We have actually decreased the average number of days a kid stays with us from over 90 days down to 44 days. That is how fast we are trying to get the kids out to sponsors, family members here in the United States. So we don't want any kid with us one day longer than they have to be.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: This is not what HHS or the U.S. government doesn't have facilities to detain families. That's -- we never had this problem until the magnet was created at the border. One federal, you and I both clerked together. The federal courts have a lot of power in putting these nationwide injunctions. You've seen it at HHS across a whole bunch of issues, and I think that's another issue this administration has to hit. We have to talk about what's going on with prescription drug crisis. If I hear from one more person of the cost of prescription drugs, the president said he was going to deliver. Today, I'm looking at Twitter. The president could be delivering on this. I'm going to be skeptical. What has happened?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: So what the president did today is he signed an executive order that does what Democrats and Republicans for decades have said we should do, which is have transparency of pricing and quality in our health care system.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Meaning if you go to get an MRI on your neck?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: You should know before you go how much it will cost, and you ought to know where else you can get it cheaper, and you ought to know the quality of the service where its' delivered.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: And that one would drive the price down, obviously, like with Lasik surgery, we had the prices come down over the years.

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: What is one part of health care that actually functions, Lasik surgery. Every year quality goes up and price goes down. It's the only part of our economy where we don't have pricing.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Why hasn't this been done before?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: Because nobody has ever had the courage that President Trump has to take on the special interests. Trust me, Laura, they are going to come out with their teeth and claws and go after us for this.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I'm worried there are people -- this is my view but maybe I'm all wrong -- inside the administration who are such purists, like libertarian purists. You can't do this. But this is the president's agenda, is it not? He is a conservative realist. And he's a bit of a populist on this issue. These prices have to come down and there has be fairness across the board for Americans seeking this care.

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: The president is absolutely a populist on health care. He is looking out for the average worker. His motto is, I want affordable, personalized, patient centered health because it puts you in control that treats you like a human being and not like a number.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Are the Democrats giving you a high five? Any support, thanks, we'll work?

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: Actually, on this area of transparency on price and quality, I think we all can get together on that. In fact, I have gotten communications from some Democrats today saying, wow, you guys are actually doing that? Â We can't believe you have the courage to take on these special interests.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: OK, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce, I've been warning about them for years. I'm sure there are good people there, but this is an ad they ran against you, Alex. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: In America, the government doesn't set drug prices or block seniors' access to life-saving drugs because a bureaucrat decides it's not worth the price. But that's exactly what happens in many foreign countries. Now the Department of Health and Human Services wants to impose the same failed foreign price controls on Medicare.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: It's like a movie trailer, the secretary, you're the villain. I like the ones that show your face and make you look really scary, and you're not really that scary.

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: Laura, you know what socialism is? Socialism is asking American seniors to play list price for their drugs to prop up the socialist systems in Europe. That's what's going on, and President Trump and I are going to break it.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: They have got a lot of cheap drugs over there in Europe, and our people are funding all that stuff or subsidizing it. It all has to be a little bit more level, level the playing field.

utterances.speaker: AZAR
utterances.utterance: A little more level.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Great to see you, Secretary Azar, thanks so much. And up next, the liberal governor of the biggest state in the country says that hypermasculinity will kill the GOP. In moments a psychiatrist is here to tell us how to diagnose that one. Don't go away.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: It's no big surprise, it's becoming more pervasive in society, the decline of traditionalism, however you define it. Let's start in California where liberal Governor Gavin Newsom was asked about this previous statement about men in today's society.

utterances.speaker: GOV. GAVIN NEWSOM, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: I would argue the most dangerous words in the English language are "man up." "Be a man." "Don't be a sissy."

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Most people say it's an expression, like man up.

utterances.speaker: NEWSOM
utterances.utterance: That reinforces the framing.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: But you're saying that --

utterances.speaker: NEWSOM
utterances.utterance: I think that is a weak thing to say. They been sold a complete bill of bullshit. The Republican Party has walked off a cliff. They are third party status. They don't even know what is about to hit them.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Governor Newsom's comments were revealed just a day after an ABC affiliate in Houston created a story about a nine-year-old boy who is a drag queen spreading a, quote, message of love. So is this diverse expression or using a child for a political end? Joining me now to analyze all of this, Doctor and Psychiatrist Carole Lieberman. Dr. Lieberman, I want to begin with Governor Newsom of your state saying this is a dark, dark situation with masculinity in America. Â Your view?

utterances.speaker: DR. CAROLE LIEBERMAN, PSYCHIATRIST
utterances.utterance: Well, yes, obviously, he was traumatized as a young boy by people telling him to man up and not to be a sissy and so on. And he is still traumatized by it. And he's projecting onto Trump about this hypermasculinity because, really, he has done more to go against Trump and, in fact, making decisions that really are more about making Trump angry then what's best for California. And so he's trying to -- hypermasculinity, all about physical strength, aggression, and sexuality. And who is the biggest man? And he's putting himself opposite Trump and trying to show that he's the bigger man.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: OK, now I see why you're a psychiatrist. That is a really great analysis, because he's trying to one up, like men do, they try to one up each other.

utterances.speaker: LIEBERMAN
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: So he's actually doing in policy and rhetoric what he claims men are doing by flexing their muscles or saying "man up." I love that. That is something I hadn't thought of.

utterances.speaker: LIEBERMAN
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Can I ask about this other situation, with a lot of mothers, you go on mom blogs and online and social media. A lot of mothers, who even kind of more progressive mothers, are growing increasingly concerned about the sexualization of children, especially with the gender changing roles, and gender and so forth. I want to show you a boy in Austin, Texas, in a video that ABC Houston showed. Let's watch.

utterances.speaker: KEEGAN, NINE-YEAR-OLD DRAG QUEEN
utterances.utterance: I want the world to know that you can be special, and you can be who you want to be. You can be a vegetarian. You can even be a veterinarian. You can be LGBTQ, you can be a drag queen, drag king.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: His mom said she's not pushing any political agenda. We have no agenda. It's all about basically not trying to put a label on this. Your thoughts?

utterances.speaker: LIEBERMAN
utterances.utterance: I think that his mother and father should be arrested for child abuse is what I really think. They are turning this child into a puppet for their -- to get attention for them, to get money through social media and through these appearances, and so on. It's not about what he wants to do. He's only nine-years-old. Look at him, how he talked in that video. Â There is something not real about it. And kids are too young to know about sexuality, to know about gender, to have all of these things thrown at them, oftentimes in school. They are being taught things that really they don't understand these things at this age. And it is totally messing them up. And when they get to be teenagers, when they have puberty and they start thinking for themselves about what they want, that is when things are really going to come home to roost because they're going to feel suicidal and so on. They don't understand. All they know is that he's getting a lot of attention for this and his parents are happy. What it has to do with, for the most part, parents like to think that they are being progressive, and really what it has to do with is his some psychological issues that the parents have that they're projecting onto their child.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Well, and dressing a little boy up as Carol Channing, and he obviously doesn't know who Carol Channing is. People talk about JonBenet Ramsey and the pageants, and they thought that was sexualization, 1996. Â Look at where we are all these years later, and this is being celebrated by a local -- it's very tough. And it's all about the children and protecting children. I think everyone, every mother and every father, it's about protecting children. We don't want anyone bullied, and we don't want kids to be sexualized at a young age. It's just wrong.

utterances.speaker: LIEBERMAN
